venue.name: Front Street, Lincoln, Bikepath Parking Lot

item.description:
I've barely ridden my bike all year.  This must not stand. I'll be biking the Blackstone River bike path this Sunday, the 19th of June, at 1:15 PM.

 

This is NOT a race! It will NOT be a fast ride! I haven't biked in months, so I'm not even sure that I'll be able to keep my balance. No need to be nervous if you are not a fast bicyclist. It's a social ride. If you want to just do a portion of the ride, feel free.

If it is raining OR I get fewer than THREE YESes by Saturday, I will reschedule for another day.

The Blackstone River Bikeway is 10 miles of paved bike path from Lincoln through Valley Falls Heritage Park in Cumberland and ends in Woonsocket at the Water Treatment Plant on Manville Hill Road. We often take a break to chat at the end of the path before turning around.

Meet us at The Blackstone River State Park, Front Street, Lincoln. To find us: pull into the address listed above, go down the road for maybe a mile and we'll be at the first parking lot on your right.

PLEASE, PLEASE, PLEASE remember to take my cell phone number: 401-699-7304 in case you can't find us.
item.how_to_find_us: I've got a red bike and a red car. My cell is (401) 699-7304
item.name: Blackstone River Bike Path - 10 Miles Long - 20 Miles Total Trip Back & Forth
